New Records: Shreyas Iyer scored his highest T20I score of 67
Key Match Events: Jason Roy's 49-run knock helped England overhaul the target of 125
Shreyas Iyer top-scored for the hosts with an impressive 48-ball 67
Jofra Archer registered impressive figures of 3/23
Ben Stokes claimed Rishabh Pant's wicket
Dawid Malan and Jonny Bairstow chased down the target of 125 and steered England home with 27 balls to spare
Pre-Game Insights: Experts predicted India as the favorites given their home advantage
Eoin Morgan emphasized England's focus on improving their powerplay performance
Post-Match Reflections: Eoin Morgan's side in which both the bowling and batting department excelled
England win the first T20I by eight wickets
Miscellaneous Highlights: India posted 124/7, rescued by Shreyas Iyer's 48-ball 67-run knock
England are the current occupants of the ICC's No.1 ranking in T20I cricket with India sitting just below
A series win for either team will be a boost for their confidence ahead of this year's ICC T20 World Cup 2021 in India
Others: The Gujarat Cricket Association (GCA) has decided to allow 50 percent of spectators during the India-England T20I series at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad owing to the pandemic
